The Chancellor of the Exchequer would be obliged if thefollowing corrections oould be made on the circulated copiesof his Memorandum on the League of Nations, the InternationalLabour Office) and National Finance - CP.2170, I. The League of Nations. The last paragraph to read - "I do not ask that mm m WiK instructions (b) and (c) should apply to Ministers attending the League or its subordinate Bodies, for I rely upon their experience, their knowledge and discretion to protect the British Exchequer." 11* The International Labour Bureau. Proposal (f) to read - "To say that If such a course is - pursued without their express concurrence H.M, Government will not be responsible for any part of the expense".2, Whitehall Gardens, S,'", December 1st 1920,
